div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner. vs Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, Respondents.
No. A N S W E R .
Come now the respondents by their attorneys Sweeney and Steiner and answering petitioner's petition for habeas corpus allege:

That on or about the 20th. day of January, 1904, petitioner, Peter A. Clifford filed in for the Superior Court of the State of Wash- ington, for King County in the cause numbered 41727, entitled "Peter A. Clifford, petitioner, vs Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, respondents", praying for a writ of habeas corpis to bring the body of Alice B. Clifford before said Superior Court to abide such order as said Court may direct, a copy of which said petition is hereto attached marked "Exhibit A", and hereby reffered to and made a part hereof; that thereupon in response to said petition a writ of heabeas corpus was issued returnable before the Honorab;e George E. Norris, one of the judges in the above entitled court. which said writ is hereto attached and marked "Exhibit B" and is hereby referred to and made a part hereof; that respondents there- upon appeared in said action and filed their answer or return to said petition which said answer or return is hereto attached and marked "Exhibit C" and is hereby referred to and made a part hereof; that in obedience to said writ, the body of said Alice B. Clifford was produced on the 22nd day of Janurary, 1904, before the said Court, where upon the said cause was referred to by his Honor, George E. Norris to the Honorable Boyd J. Tallman, also one of the judges of the aforesaid Superior Court, and continued to January 25, 1904, at which time and place the body of said Alice B. Clifford was produced before his Honor, Boyd J. Tallan and a full and complete hearing had on said petition. That at said hearing, evidence was introduced by the petitioner and re- spondents and the cause argued at length by counsel for petitioner and respondents, and at the conclusion of said hearing, the Court, being fully advised in the premises, made an order sustaining the validity of the decree of adoption; dissolving said writ of habeas corpus and demanding said infant, Alice B. Clifford to the care, custody and control of respondents, which said order is hereto at- tached, marked "Exhibit D" and is hereby referred to and made a part hereof; that the parties in said cause number 41727 were identical with the parties in this cause; that the subject matter in controversy was identical; that the facts at issue in said cause number 41727 and in this case are identical and that no new facts have since arisen; that the petition in said cause umber 41727 and in this cause are identical with the exception of slight and imma- terial variations; that the subject matter at issue in this cause has been and the facts involved were fully and finally adjudicated in said cause number 41727, by his Honor, Boyd J. Tallman, Judge of the Superior Court, State of Washington, for King County, and the status of said infant, Alice B. Clifford was thereby fixed and es tablished, and the custody of said infant awarded to respondents herein.

That by reason of said writ of habeas corpus in number 41727 and the proceedings had therein. and the full and final ad- judication thereof petitioner is estopped from further questioninh respondents rigt to the custody of said infant, Alice B. Clifford by reason of said former adjudication.
That respondents claim the rightful custody of the said infant, Alice B. Clifford by reason of the aforesaid adjudication.
WHEREFORE, respondents pray that the writ of habeas corpus issued herein may be dissolved and the said infant, Alice B. Clifford be remanded to the custody of respondents.
Further answering the petitioner's petition herein re- spondents allege:

That on or about the 12th, day of November, 1903, respondenta petitioned the Superior Court of the State of Washington, for King County, in cause number 5262, entitled "In the matter of the adoption of Alice B. Clifford, an infant, by Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, his wife, "for permission to adopt said child, Alice B. Clifford as their own. That thereafter, such proceedings were had that a decree of adoption was entered by said Supreme Court adjudging thatfrom and after said date, said infant, Alice B. Clifford should to all legal intents and purposes, be the child of petitioners respondents herein the same as if she had been born to them in lawful wedlock, and that the name of said child be changed to Alice B. Williams, a copy of which decree is hereto attached and marked "Exhibit E", which decree is hereby referred to and made a part hereof, and by virtue of which respondents have the custody of said infant now known as Alice B. Williams, and claim to be her rightful custodians.

Respondents further allege that petitioner did on or about the 5th, day of June, 1904, file a petition in said cause number 5262, praying that the decree of adoption therein made and entered be set aside and held for naught, which said petition is now pending in said Superior Court.

Further answering the petitioner's petition herein re- spondents hereby refer to and make a part hereof their said answer in said cause number 41727, attached hereto and marked "Exhibit C", as fully and completely as if said answer was here repeated.

Wherefore, having fully answered petitioner's petition, respondents pray that the writ of habeas corpus heretofore issued herein be dissolved and said infant, be remanded to the custody of respondents and that said respondents be awarded their coats here- in.
United States of America, ) District of Washington, ) SS. Northern Division. )

Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams being first duly sworn on oath, depose and say: that they are the respondents in the above entitled cause; that they have read the foregoing answer, know the contents thereof and the same is true.
Herbert O. Williams Grace E. Williams Subscribed and sworn to before me this 10 day of June, 1904. G. E. Steiner Resides in Seattle, WA the Notary Public, residing Seattle Wash
